item.title: African Ratings Company Plans to Launch in Third Quarter
item.description: The African Credit Rating Agency, a continental initiative to provide alternative assessments of repayment risks, plans to start operations by the end of September.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Hill

media:content.media:description: A vendor hands a Ghana cedi banknote to a customer at the Makola market in Accra, Ghana, on Friday, May 10, 2024. Ghana's cedi has declined 14% this year, a slump beaten only by currencies that have been devalued, including the Egyptian pound and Nigerian naira.

item.title: America Cast Itself as the World’s Moral Leader. Not Anymore
item.description: Trump is declaring an end to a postwar precedent.
item.dc:creator: Brad Stone

item.title: Trump’s Tariff Chaos Threatens His Push for Rust Belt Revival
item.description: President Donald Trump’s signature trade policy is threatening to backfire by upending other top priorities: the revival of US manufacturing and the American Rust Belt.
item.dc:creator: Mark Niquette, Miranda Davis, Brooke Sutherland

media:content.media:description: A sign in support of Donald Trump in front of a junkyard in downtown Springfield, OH,

item.title: Everyone Is Buying Time in an Unstable World
item.description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
item.dc:creator: Alberto Nardelli

media:content.media:description: Donald Trump and Xi Jinping Photographer: Bonnie Cash/UPI, Oliver Bunic/Bloomberg

item.title: Ukrainian Drones Hit Russian Plant Involved in Missile Output
item.description: Ukraine said its drones hit a Russian research and production facility that supplies components for missiles, as Russia unleashed a fresh barrage of air attacks overnight.
item.dc:creator: Daryna Krasnolutska

media:content.media:description: Ukraine said its drones hit a Russian facility that supplies components for missiles including for the Iskander system.

item.title: Senate Republicans Plan to Release Major Revisions to Trump’s Tax Bill
item.description: Senate Republicans intend to propose revised tax and health-care provisions to President Donald Trump’s $3 trillion signature economic package this week, shrugging off condemnations of the legislation by Elon Musk as they rush to enact it before July 4.
item.dc:creator: Erik Wasson

media:content.media:description: The US Capitol in Washington, DC, US, on Thursday, June 5, 2025. US House Speaker Mike Johnson said he is fighting to maintain the new $40,000 cap on state and local deductions in the draft tax bill now before the Senate, where Republicans are seeking to enact a less generous break.

item.title: Chinese Aircraft Carrier Seen Operating Deeper Into Pacific
item.description: A Chinese aircraft carrier made one of its deepest forays into the Pacific Ocean over the weekend as Beijing continues to project its military power further from its shores.
item.dc:creator: Alastair Gale

media:content.media:description: The aircraft carrier Liaoning

item.title: Japan Should Use Asia Trade Bloc in US Talks, Party Chief Says
item.description: Japan should take a bigger role in a regional free trade agreement and use its expansion as a bargaining tool in tariff negotiations with the US, the leader of the country’s largest opposition party said on Monday.
item.dc:creator: Erica Yokoyama

media:content.media:description: Yoshihiko Noda

item.title: NATO’s Rutte Calls For ‘Quantum Leap’ in Defense Investment
item.description: NATO Secretary General Mark Rutte said members of the military alliance need to deliver a “quantum leap” in their collective defense amid the ongoing threat from Russia.
item.dc:creator: Joe Mayes

media:content.media:description: Mark Rutte Photographer: Simon Wohlfahrt/Bloomberg

item.title: S. Korea’s Lee, Japan’s Ishiba Vow to Boost Ties in First Call
item.description: South Korea’s President Lee Jae-myung and Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba held their first phone conversation and vowed to seek ways to deepen bilateral ties so both nations can respond together to future challenges.
item.dc:creator: Soo-Hyang Choi, Sakura Murakami

media:content.media:description: Photo by Kazuhiro NOGI/AFP/Getty Images Photographer: KAZUHIRO NOGI/AFP

item.title: LA Clashes Escalate as Trump, Newsom Spar Over National Guard
item.description: Tensions flared in Los Angeles on the third day of anti-deportation protests, as demonstrators clashed with law enforcement while President Donald Trump and California Governor Gavin Newsom exchanged blame over the unrest and responsibility for restoring order.
item.dc:creator: Alicia A. Caldwell, John Gittelsohn

media:content.media:description: A demonstrator on a burned out car during protests in Paramount, California.

item.title: US, China to Resume Trade Talks With Focus on Rare Earths
item.description: The US and China are set to resume trade negotiations in London on Monday in a bid to further defuse tensions over rare-earth minerals and advanced technology following a phone call between leaders Donald Trump and Xi Jinping last week.
item.dc:creator: Catherine Lucey, Daniel Flatley

item.title: Israel Blocks Greta Thunberg’s Ship From Reaching Gaza, Group Says
item.description: Israel intercepted a humanitarian aid ship trying to reach Gaza that was carrying activists including Swedish climate advocate Greta Thunberg, the group operating the vessel said.
item.dc:creator: Alisa Odenheimer, Jon Herskovitz

media:content.media:description: The Freedom Flotilla Coalition releases a photo on June 9 it says shows their ship Madleen being intercepted by Israeli authorities as it traveled to to Gaza. Source: Freedom Flotilla Coalition

item.title: Senator in Intensive Care Shows Colombia Spinning Out of Control
item.description: Last Thursday, presidential hopeful Miguel Uribe Turbay warned that Colombia was fast sinking back into its violent past. Two days later, a gunman shot him in the head during a rally.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Bristow, Patricia Laya

media:content.media:description: A protest against violence the day after the attack on Uribe in Medellin, Colombia, on June 8. Photographer: Jaime Saldarriaga/AFP/Getty Images

item.title: LA Mayor Bass Seeks Peace After Trump Calls in National Guard
item.description: Los Angeles Mayor Karen Bass called for peace as thousands of people demonstrating against immigration raids clashed with security forces for a third day.
item.dc:creator: Virginia Van Natta, Isabela Fleischmann

media:content.media:description: The National Guard, police and protesters stand off outside of a downtown jail in Los Angeles on June 8. Photographer: Spencer Platt/Getty Images

item.title: Starmer Calls on Nvidia’s Huang to Train Up Britons on AI
item.description: Keir Starmer will make an appearance alongside Nvidia Corp co-founder Jensen Huang on Monday, as the British prime minister puts technology and artificial intelligence at the heart of his government’s plan to boost economic growth.
item.dc:creator: Julian Harris

media:content.media:description: Keir Starmer and Jensen Huang during London Tech Week on June 9. Photographer: Jason Alden/Bloomberg

item.title: Trump Says National Guard Will Restore Order, End Unrest in LA
item.description: President Donald Trump pledged Sunday to send whatever is necessary to California to respond to two days of protests in Los Angeles triggered by sweeping immigration raids.
item.dc:creator: Vincent Lee, Maria Paula Mijares Torres, Catherine Lucey

media:content.media:description: LOS ANGELES, CALIFORNIA - JUNE 08: National Guard troops stand outside the Metropolitan Detention Center, MDC on June 08, 2025 in Los Angeles, California. Tensions in the city remain high after the Trump administration called in the National Guard against the wishes of city leaders following two days of clashes with police during a series of immigration raids. More protests are scheduled for today. (Photo by Spencer Platt/Getty Images)

item.title: Italy Votes on Citizenship, Job Protections Amid Turnout Concern
item.description: ROME (AP) — Italians vote over two days starting Sunday in referendums that would make it easier for children born in Italy to foreigners to obtain citizenship, and on providing more job protections. But apparent low public awareness risks rendering the votes invalid if turnout is not high enough.

media:content.media:description: Campaign posters calling for a vote in a referendum in downtown Rome.

item.title: Venezuela Plans a 50% Fuel Hike as It Braces for Revenue Slump
item.description: Venezuela’s government is laying the groundwork for a 50% hike in fuel prices at the pump as it braces for a decrease in revenues after US oil major Chevron and other oil firms halted work in the country.
item.dc:creator: Fabiola Zerpa

media:content.media:description: A Petroleos de Venezuela SA (PDVSA) gas station in Puerto La Cruz, Anzoategui state, Venezuela, on Monday, May 22, 2023. Venezuela’s Oil ministry published oil and gas reserves for years 2019 through 2022, according to a decree in the official gazette dated May 9.

item.title: Renault In Discussions With France to Make Drones in Ukraine
item.description: French automaker Renault SA has held discussions with the French defense ministry to produce drones in Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: Ania Nussbaum

media:content.media:description: A badge on a vehicle displayed on the Renault SA stand on day two of the Geneva International Motor Show in Geneva, Switzerland, on Tuesday, Feb. 27, 2024. The show runs until Sunday, March 3.

item.title: Spain Opposition Calls for Early Elections as Thousands Rally in Madrid
item.description: Spain’s main opposition party rallied thousands of people in a demonstration in the heart of Madrid, calling for early elections following accusations of corruption against the Socialist-led government of Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez.
item.dc:creator: Thomas Gualtieri

media:content.media:description: PP's President Alberto Nunez Feijoo talks on stage during a demonstration called by Spain's right-wing opposition party Partido Popular (PP) to protest against the ruling government in Plaza de Espana square in Madrid on June 8, 2025. (Photo by Thomas COEX / AFP) (Photo by THOMAS COEX/AFP via Getty Images)

item.title: Israel Says It Recovered Body of Hamas Commander Mohammed Sinwar
item.description: The Israeli army on Sunday said it recovered the body of Mohammed Sinwar, a senior Hamas commander who was killed in a May 13 airstrike at a Gaza hospital.
item.dc:creator: Marissa Newman

media:content.media:description: Palestinians inspect the damage from an Israeli airstrike on May 13 outside the Gaza European Hospital in eastern Khan Younis, southern Gaza, on Wednesday, May 14, 2025. French President Emmanuel Macron accused Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of “shameful” behavior in blocking aid to Gaza, and called on the European Union to toughen its stance against the country.

item.title: Colombia Candidate Fighting for Life After Assassination Bid
item.description: Colombian presidential candidate Miguel Uribe Turbay remains in a critical condition after an assassination attempt on Saturday that recalled the political violence that roiled the nation in the 1980s and 1990s.
item.dc:creator: Patricia Laya, Andreina Itriago

media:content.media:description: Miguel Uribe Photographer: Sebastian Barros/NurPhoto/Getty Images

item.title: US Seeks Deal in London on China Rare Earth Flows, Hassett Says
item.description: US negotiators will aim to restore the flow of critical minerals when they meet their Chinese counterparts for a new round of trade negotiations Monday in London, a top economic aide to President Donald Trump said.
item.dc:creator: Vincent Lee

media:content.media:description: Various rare earth minerals on display in a showroom at the Baotou Jiangxin Micro Motor Technology Co., in Baotou, Inner Mongolia, China, on Thursday, June 1, 2023. Traditionally a center for coal and steel, the city is marketing itself as the “World’s Green Silicon City,” to lure factories that process the metal needed for semiconductors with low-cost, renewable power.

item.title: Israel Vows to Stop Greta Thunberg’s Ship From Reaching Gaza
item.description: Israel won’t allow a humanitarian aid ship — carrying activists including Swedish climate advocate Greta Thunberg — to reach Gaza, Defense Minister Israel Katz said on Sunday.
item.dc:creator: Alisa Odenheimer

media:content.media:description: Greta Thunberg speaking at the press conference. Greta is part of the crew of the ship Madleen, headed to Gaza to deliver humanitarian aid on June 01, 2025 in Catania, Italy.

item.title: Gaza Militia With Ties to Israel Emerges to Challenge Hamas
item.description: A Palestinian militia operating with tacit approval from Israel has surfaced in the war-ravaged Gaza Strip to challenge the rule of Hamas, which threatened a crackdown in turn.
item.dc:creator: Fares Alghoul, Dan Williams

media:content.media:description: Dislocated Palestinian refugees flee to find safety in Gaza, Palestinian territories on March 20, 2025. (Photo by Youssef Alzanoun / Middle East Images / Middle East Images via AFP) (Photo by YOUSSEF ALZANOUN/Middle East Images/AFP via Getty Images)

item.title: Ukraine Rejects Claim Russian Forces Enter Key Central Region
item.description: Kyiv’s armed forces rejected as “disinformation” Russia’s claim that its ground troops have crossed into Ukraine’s Dnipropetrovsk region for the first time, even as prospects for a US-brokered ceasefire remain elusive.
item.dc:creator: Kateryna Chursina, Aliaksandr Kudrytski

media:content.media:description: A road sign marking the entrance to the Dnipropetrovsk region.

item.title: Thailand, Cambodia Agree to De-Escalate Border Standoff
item.description: The governments of Thailand and Cambodia agreed to de-escalate a border standoff by adjusting military forces in the conflict zone, following a skirmish in late May. The decision was announced by Thai Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra in a post on X late Sunday.
item.dc:creator: Pathom Sangwongwanich

media:content.media:description: A Thai soldier stands guard at the disputed ancient Khmer temple Prasat Ta Muen Thom, or Prasat Ta Moan Thom in Khmer, on the Cambodian-Thai border in Oddar Meanchey province on March 26, 2025. (Photo by TANG CHHIN Sothy / AFP) (Photo by TANG CHHIN SOTHY/AFP via Getty Images)

item.title: Trump to Send 2,000 National Guard Troops to Calm LA Unrest
item.description: President Donald Trump will send the National Guard to restore order in Los Angeles in response to growing unrest over a wave of federal immigration raids.
item.dc:creator: Alicia A. Caldwell, Sarah McGregor, Janine Phakdeetham

media:content.media:description: Police fire tear gas during protests against ICE and immigration raids in Paramount, California, on June 7. Photographer: Myung J. Chun/Los Angeles Times/Getty Images

item.title: Westinghouse In Talks for Role in US Nuclear Expansion Plan: FT
item.description: Westinghouse Electric Co. is in discussions with US officials to deploy 10 large nuclear reactors, as it seeks a role in fulfilling President Donald Trump’s ambitions to bolster America’s nuclear energy capabilities, the Financial Times reported.
item.dc:creator: Chloe Meley

media:content.media:description: A handout illustration shows Westinghouse Electric Co.'s AP 1000 Reactor.
